    • Constructor Detail

      • DependencyGraph

        public DependencyGraph(IEnvironment<T> environment,
                       Map<IReaction<T>,IDependencyHandler<T>> handlers)
        This constructor builds a new, empty dependency graph. It relies on a map of neighborhoods in order to retrieve them efficiently and on a map of reactions in order to get handlers given a reaction.
        Parameters:
        environment - the environment
        handlers - A map storing, for each reaction, its handler.

    • Method Detail

      • createDependencies

        public void createDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
        Description copied from interface: IDependencyGraph
        This method creates the dependencies when a new reaction is added to the environment. Please be careful when building the environment and populating the existing reactions map: this method assumes that all the dependencies among the existing reactions are correct and up to date.
        Specified by:
        createDependencies in interface IDependencyGraph<T>
        Parameters:
        rh - the reaction handler whose dependencies should be calculated.

      • removeDependencies

        public void removeDependencies(IDependencyHandler<T> rh)
        Description copied from interface: IDependencyGraph
        This method removes all the dependencies (both in and out dependencies) for a given reaction handler. This method is meant to be used in order to keep the dependencies clean when removing a reaction.
        Specified by:
        removeDependencies in interface IDependencyGraph<T>
        Parameters:
        rh - the reaction handler whose dependencies will be deleted.

        public void addNeighbor(INode<T> n1,
                        INode<T> n2)
        Description copied from interface: IDependencyGraph

        Parameters:
